intro: Eleocharis uniglumis, commonly known as the single-stem sedge, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, forming dense clusters with slender, grass-like stems. Its small, spike-like inflorescence contains numerous tiny flowers, which are adapted for wind pollination. Eleocharis uniglumis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
